titleStmt.title: Culmers crown crackt with his own looking-glass, or, The Cocks-combs looking-glasse broken about his ears and a counter-mirror held forth to all good people, for their undeceiving in the pretended sufferings of that pseudo-martyr, and grand imposter of this age, Blew Dick of Thanet : reflecting from certain pertinent observations upon an impertinent, false and frivolous Apology of his ascribed to his more ingenuous son, but scribed by his most ignominious self : wherein especially all the world may see the ugly face of that prodigious monster ...
titleStmt.author: Philo-katoptrono-klastes.

titleStmt.title: Culmers crown crackt with his own looking-glass, or, The Cocks-combs looking-glasse broken about his ears and a counter-mirror held forth to all good people, for their undeceiving in the pretended sufferings of that pseudo-martyr, and grand imposter of this age, Blew Dick of Thanet : reflecting from certain pertinent observations upon an impertinent, false and frivolous Apology of his ascribed to his more ingenuous son, but scribed by his most ignominious self : wherein especially all the world may see the ugly face of that prodigious monster ...
titleStmt.author: Philo-katoptrono-klastes.

notesStmt.note: "No knave to the pretended religious knave."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
